claimGovernance().details: Second and final step of the two-step governance transfer processSee `transferGovernance`Sets the governance transfer flag to falseAfter a successful call to this function, the actual governance      address and the provisional governance address MUST be equal.

deployPool((string,uint32,uint32,uint16,.details: Throws if pool keeper is nullThrows if deployer does not own the oracle wrapperThrows if leverage amount is invalidThrows if decimal precision is too high (i.e., greater than `MAX_DECIMALS`)The IOracleWrapper declares a `deployer` variable, this is used here to confirm that the pool which uses said oracle wrapper is indeed      the intended address. This is to prevent a griefing attack in which someone uses the same oracle wrapper with the same parameters *before* the genuine deployer.

params.deploymentParameters: Deployment parameters of the market. Some may be reconfigurable.

setAutoClaim(address).details: Throws if provided address is nullOnly callable by the owner

setFee(uint256).details: This is a percentage in WAD; multiplied by 10^18 e.g. 5% is 0.05 * 10^18Throws if fee is greater than 10%Emits a `FeeChanged` event on success

params._fee: The fee amount as a percentage

setFeeReceiver(address).details: Only callable by the owner of this contractThis fuction does not change anything for already deployed pools, only pools deployed after the changeEmits a `FeeReceiverChanged` event on success

setInvariantCheck(address).details: Throws if provided address is nullOnly callable by the owner

setPoolKeeper(address).details: Throws if provided address is nullOnly callable by the ownerEmits a `PoolKeeperChanged` event on success

setSecondaryFeeSplitPercent(uint256).details: Only callable by the owner of this contractThrows if `newFeePercent` exceeds 100Emits a `SecondaryFeeSplitChanged` event on success

transferGovernance(address).details: First step of the two-step governance transfer processSets the governance transfer flag to trueSee `claimGovernance`

params._governance: New address of the governance of the pool

AutoClaimChanged(address).notice: Indicates that the AutoClaim contract has changed

DeployCommitter(address,address,address,.notice: Creates a notification when a PoolCommitter is deployed

DeployPool(address,address,string).notice: Creates a notification when a pool is deployed

FeeChanged(uint256).notice: Indicates that the trading fee has changed

FeeReceiverChanged(address).notice: Indicates that the receipient of fees has changed

InvariantCheckChanged(address).notice: Indicates that the InvariantCheck contract has changed

MaxLeverageChanged(uint256).notice: Indicates that the maximum allowed leverage has changed

MintAndBurnFeesChanged(uint256,uint256).notice: Indicates that the minting and burning fees have changed

PoolKeeperChanged(address).notice: Creates a notification when the pool keeper changes

ProvisionalGovernanceChanged(address).notice: Represents proposed change in governance address

SecondaryFeeSplitChanged(uint256).notice: Indicates that the receipient of fees has changed

claimGovernance().notice: Completes transfer of governance by actually changing permissions          over the pool.

deployPool((string,uint32,uint32,uint16,.notice: Deploy a leveraged pool and its committer/pool tokens with given parametersRebasing tokens are not supported and will break functionality

setAutoClaim(address).notice: Sets the address of the associated `AutoClaim` contract

setFee(uint256).notice: Set the yearly fee amount. The max yearly fee is 10%

setFeeReceiver(address).notice: Sets the primary fee receiver of deployed Leveraged pools.

setInvariantCheck(address).notice: Sets the address of the associated `InvariantCheck` contract

setPoolKeeper(address).notice: Sets the address of the associated `PoolKeeper` contract

setSecondaryFeeSplitPercent(uint256).notice: Sets the proportion of fees to be split to the nominated secondary fees recipient

transferGovernance(address).notice: Starts to transfer governance of the pool. The new governance          address must call `claimGovernance` in order for this to take          effect. Until this occurs, the existing governance address          remains in control of the pool.
